data.title: The sugar industry began funding research that cast doubt on sugar's role in heart disease — in part by pointing the finger at fat — as early as the 1960s, according to an analysis of newly uncovered documents.
Pentagon confirms it killed senior ISIS leader Abu Muhammad al-Adnani
Cambodian police find 80% of overnight bus and truck drivers on meth
Earth just had its hottest August on record, NASA finds

Indonesian seaweed farmers sue in major oil spill case: 13,000 Indonesian seaweed farmers have launched a massive class action in Australia's federal court demanding compensation for the effects of Australia's worst oil spill.
North Korea makes rare public appeal for flood relief after death toll rises to 133 with almost 400 still missing
Police ignore Muslim officers’ ‘extremism’ to avoid Islamophobia accusations, claims Muslim officer

Women in Palestine are using Twitter and Facebook to fight back against censorship of their names: Some materials produced for October's cancelled local elections had replaced the names of female candidates with just their initials or epithets such as 'wife of'
US, Japan scramble for 'strongest' sanctions against NKorea

The long-lost ship of British polar explorer Sir John Franklin, HMS Terror, has been found in pristine condition at the bottom of an Arctic bay, researchers have said, in a discovery that challenges the accepted history behind one of polar exploration’s deepest mysteries.
Obama will veto bill allowing 9/11 lawsuits against Saudi Arabia, White House says
Rio 2016 is the second-most attended Paralympic Games in history
Fatherland: Germany mulls law forcing mothers to reveal identity of child’s biological dad
Duterte Says U.S. Special Forces Must Leave Southern Philippines
